quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Gregory Peck and Black Sabbath
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, douglas, gregory. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1980 Gregory Peck made unpaid ads for the Chrysler Automobile Corporation .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these movies did guitarist Tony Iommi appear in?

options.text: The Beatles A Hard Days Night
The Rolling Stones Rock and Roll Circus

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rolling Stones Rock and Roll Circus

questions.question: Select the correct statement about Gregory Pecks life.

options.text: His father ran a small theater outside of Los Angeles.
He never completed his college degree at U Cal Berkley.
At about 23 he left California to become an actor in New York City.
He had a very stable childhood living in the suburbs of Los Angeles.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: At about 23 he left California to become an actor in New York City.

questions.question: In 1968, Toni Iommi briefly left Black Sabbath to play in this band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jethro Tull

questions.question: In what city was Black Sabbath formed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Birmingham

questions.question: After starring in 1958s  The Bravados, Gregory Peck made this decision.

options.text: To help form section of the Motion Picture Academy for cowboy actors.
To buy a real working ranch and raise horses

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To buy a real working ranch and raise horses

questions.question: In 1947 Gregory Peck founded this important theater with the help of Mel Ferrer and Dorothy McGuire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: La Jolla Playhouse

questions.question: Gregory Peck had many  close friends. Which of the following was not one of them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Reagan

questions.question: Gregory Peck was well known as an active supporter of the Republican Party.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Gregory Peck felt that the American Film Institute was just a useless organization.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In 1967 Gregory Peck received The Jean Hersholt Award from the Academy of Motion Pictures Arts  Science. This award is given for which of the following?

options.text: Being a member of the Academy for at least 40 years
Never receiving an Oscar and being in many movies

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Humanitarian activities

questions.question: What do Gene Autry, Kirk Douglas, Gregory Peck and Jimmy Stewart have in common?

options.text: They all served on B-17s during World War II.
Their stars on Hollywoods Walk of Fame were stolen.
They all helped Ronald Reagans campaign for the Presidency.
They were speakers at Governor Schwarzeneggers inauguration.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Their stars on Hollywoods Walk of Fame were stolen.

questions.question: What was the last Black Sabbath studio album with Ozzy Osbourne as lead singer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Never Say Die!

questions.question: Which statement is true about Gregory Pecks birth?

options.text: He was born Eldred Gregory Peck on April 5, 1916 in La Jolla, California.
He was born Ronald Richard Gregory on April 5, 1914 in San Francisco, California.
He was born Richard Gregory Peck on April 5, 1917 in Santa Barbara, California.
He was born Gregory Edward Peck on April 5, 1915 in Pasadena, California.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was born Eldred Gregory Peck on April 5, 1916 in La Jolla, California.

questions.question: Which of these singers never recorded albums with Black Sabbath in the period 1968-2008?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Lynn Turner

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Hank Williams and Gregory Peck
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, steve. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Gregory Peck won one Oscar. For which movie did he get the Oscar for The Best Actor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To Kill a Mocking Bird

questions.question: Steve is Hank Williams, Jr.s real first name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In 1975, country singer Hank Williams Jr. fell of off which mountain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ajax Mountain

questions.question: What is the first name of Hank Williams Jr.s son?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shelton

questions.question: Which statement is untrue about Gregory Peck?

options.text: He never appeared in an anti-war movie.
Like todays stars, he owned his own production company.
He was an opponent of nuclear weapons.
He was an opponent of gun control.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was an opponent of gun control.

questions.question: Hank Williams Jr. was 14 when his dad died.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: When was Hank Williams, Jr. born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: May 26, 1949

questions.question: Over 3,000 people tried to attend Gregory Pecks funeral. To insure that Pecks friends and relatives would have seats they were told to give this password to the ushers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atticus

questions.question: Is there a movie based on Hank Williams, Jr.s life?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Gregory Peck appeared as a hero in a Marvel comic book.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In the late 1960s Gregory Peck fought very hard but unsuccessfully for this cause.

options.text: To get statehood for Washington, D.C.
To pass the Equal Rights Amendment
To get the US out of the UN
To make full-length animated films eligible for the Best Picture Oscar

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To make full-length animated films eligible for the Best Picture Oscar

questions.question: What is Hank Williams Jr.s nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bocephus

questions.question: Which of these is not a Hank Williams Jr. song?

options.text: Thats the Kind of Life I Live

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jambalya

questions.question: What was Hank Williams Jr. first wifes name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: June

questions.question: Find the untrue statement about Gregory Peck.

options.text: He considered running for president against Ronald Reagan.
He did most of his own fight scenes.
He met his second wife when she was sent to interview him.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He considered running for president against Ronald Reagan.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Austria and Costa Rica
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, exporter, habsburg. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was the first European explorer to visit Costa Rica?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christopher Columbus

questions.question: Austria-Hungary was a vast empire that covered much of Central Europe. Which present day country was not part of this empire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Serbia

questions.question: What is the meaning of the word from which the name Austria is derived?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eastern realm

questions.question: What is the official language of Austria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: German

questions.question: In 2007, Gaston Fournier was selected to be artistic coordinator in this famous Opera House.

options.text: Metropolitan Opera House in New York

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: La Scala in Milan

questions.question: What city is the capital of Austria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vienna

questions.question: Which mountain range covers most of Austrias territory?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Alps

questions.question: Which great composer was not from Austria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johann Sebastian Bach

questions.question: Which of these animals cannot be found in Costa Rica?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giant Armadillo

questions.question: Hermann Maier (Herminator) was an Austrian star of which winter sport?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alpine skiing

questions.question: Austria is a landlocked country, which shares borders with how many other landlocked countries?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5

questions.question: In 2006, Costa Rica was the second exporter in the world of what crop?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: bananas

questions.question: What was Hank Williams Jr.s first number one album on the country charts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Songs My Father Left Me

questions.question: The House of Habsburg was a powerful dynasty from Austria that once ruled half of Europe. Which of these thrones was never occupied by a Habsburg?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Polish

questions.question: Which of these famous actors was born in Austria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Anthony Hopkins and Movie

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In the movie Hold That Ghost, what animals does Camille Brewster (Joan Davis) tell Lou Costello she cannot go to bed without?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mules

questions.question: Who is the director of the 1992 horror movie Dracula, featuring Anthony Hopkins as Professor Abraham Van Helsing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francis Ford Coppola

questions.question: What movie brought Anthony Hopkins his first Academy Award?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Silence of the Lambs

questions.question: What popular painter did Anthony Hopkins portray in a 1996 movie directed by James Ivory?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pablo Picasso

questions.question: Comedians Abbott and Costellos most famous routine is Whos on First?.  Which is the only baseball position not mentioned in that routine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rightfield

questions.question: What character did Anthony Hopkins voice in the 2000 movie How the Grinch Stole Christmas?

questions.question: Anthony Hopkins portrayed this character in the 1993 movie The Remains of the Day.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Head Butler Mr James Stevens

questions.question: In which of these sports can a father be a mudder, as explained to Costello by Abbott in one of their comedy routines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: horse racing

questions.question: What was the name of the 2001 sequel to the 1991 thriller The Silence of the Lambs, both starring Anthony Hopkins?

options.text: The Quiet Desperation of the Lambs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hannibal

questions.question: Which mathematical equation does American comedian Lou Costello in a routine use to prove that thirteen 7’s equal 28?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Quincy Adams

questions.question: What character did Anthony Hopkins portray in the 2007 movie Beowulf?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Hrothgar

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Stephen Fry and Argentina
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, schools, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Belgium

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bernardino Rivadavia

questions.question: On what continent is Argentina located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South America

options.text: A Bit of Fry and Laurie

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Bit of Fry and Laurie

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: While at University, Stephen Fry joined an amateur theatrical group where he met his comedy partner Hugh Laurie. What was the name of the theatrical group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Footlights

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rose

questions.question: What is the link between Stephen Fry and popular boy-wizard Harry Potter?

options.text: Fry is J K Rowlings cousin.
Fry owned the cafeteria at which J K Rowling wrote a lot of the early notes for Harry Potter and the Philosophers Stone.
Fry is the voice of the audiobook versions of the Harry Potter stories and their videogame adaptations.
Fry was originally offered the part of Dumbledore in the Harry Potter films.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fry is the voice of the audiobook versions of the Harry Potter stories and their videogame adaptations.

questions.question: What is the capital of Argentina?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buenos Aires

questions.question: Following his release from prison, Stephen Fry studied hard to successfully gain entrance to which University?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cambridge

questions.question: At the age of seventeen, Stephen Fry was imprisoned for 3 months for what illegal activity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fraud
